bioghist.p: Lawrence M. C. Smith's mother, Gertrude Gouverneur Clemson (1867-1947), provides the connection between the Clemson and Smith families. The daughter of the Reverend Thomas Green Clemson (1833-1888) and Sarah Frances Ogden (1833-[1910?]), Gertrude married Lewis Lawrence Smith (1864-1931) in 1892. Thomas Green Clemson (d.1888), an Episcopal churchman and rector of churches in Waddington, NY and Radnor, PA was the son of the Reverend John B. Clemson (1803-1891) and his wife, Margaretta [Jacobs?] (1809-1838). John had a brother, Thomas Green Clemson (1807-1888), who was a prominent agriculturalist and is the namesake of Clemson University. Gertrude Gouverneur Clemson's siblings included Margaretta Helen Clemson (b.1874), and Ludlow Ogden Clemson (1870-1888).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers related to various members of the Clemson family. Materials include: family letters, photos and photo albums; drawing manuals of Thomas Green Clemson, copies of sermons delivered on the occasion of people's deaths, newspaper clippings (primarily death notices), and pamphlets and notes on Clemson family genealogy.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
